ramezani-xu-2023-knowledge.title: Knowledge of cultural moral norms in large language models
ramezani-xu-2023-knowledge.author:
Ramezani, Aida  and
Xu, Yang
ramezani-xu-2023-knowledge.paperMotivationText: English LLMs have been shown to contain human-like moral biases, but previous studies typically do not examine moral variation in a diverse cultural setting.
ramezani-xu-2023-knowledge.paperContributionText: The authors investigate the extent to which monolingal English LMs contain knowledge about moral norms in different countries.
ramezani-xu-2023-knowledge.paperResultsText: They find that pre-trained English LMs predict empirical moral norms across countries worse than English moral norms, based on experiments conducted on survey data. Fine-tuning these language models on the survey data can help improve inference across countries at the expense of a less accurate estimate of the English moral norms.
ramezani-xu-2023-knowledge.resourcesOtherText: World Values Survey Wave 7 (WVS), PEW 2013 global attitude survey
